p: We assessed model performance using Area Under the Curve (AUC) as calculated by MAXENT for the test data ( Phillips, Anderson & Schapire, 2006; Ward, 2007). AUC values range from 0.5 (i.e., random) for models with no predictive ability to 1.0 (i.e., perfect discrimination between suitable and unsuitable cells) for models with a perfect prediction. According to the classification of Swets (1988), an AUC score of >0.7 (“useful” discrimination ability), >0.8 (“good” model performance) and >0.9 (“very good” model performance) was used. Since models were built for presence-only data, the background data constitute pseudo-absences for the AUC calculations ( Phillips & Dudik, 2008).
